with jsonlines.open(directory + os.sep + filenames[0]) as f:
    for line in f.iter():
        print(line.keys())
        print('\n')
        print(line['docstring'])
        print('\n')
        print(line['code'])
        break
source.5421083e:
CodeSearchNet is a collection of datasets and benchmarks that explore the problem of code retrieval using natural language. This research is a joint collaboration between GitHub and the Deep Program Understanding group at Microsoft Research - Cambridge.

The primary dataset consists of 2 million (comment, code) pairs from open source libraries. Concretely, a comment is a top-level function or method comment (e.g. docstrings in Python), and code is an entire function or method.

The aim of this notebook is that users of the dataset can get started quickly.
